definitions.definition: a reflective surface, now typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, that reflects a clear image.
examples: reflecting surface; Morefull-length mirror, hand mirror, side mirror, rear-view mirror; looking glass, glass "a quick look in the mirror"Morefull-length mirror, hand mirror, side mirror, rear-view mirror; looking glass, glass a quick look in the mirror

definitions.definition: something regarded as accurately representing something else.
examples: the stage is supposed to be the mirror of life
synonyms: parallel "his life was a mirror of her own"

definitions.definition: a site on a network that stores some or all of the contents from another site.
examples: noun: mirror site; plural noun: mirror sites

definitions.definition: (of a reflective surface) show a reflection of.
examples: the clear water mirrored the sky
gradations of educational attainment that mirror differences in social background
synonyms: correspond to "her music mirrored the mood of desperation"

definitions.definition: keep a copy of some or all of the contents of (a network site) at another site, typically in order to improve accessibility.
store copies of data on (two or more hard disks) as a method of protecting it.
